trans-unit.source: Submit Hadoop jobs in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Submit Hadoop jobs in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to submit Hadoop jobs to Azure HDInsight Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to submit Hadoop jobs to Azure HDInsight Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: Submit Hadoop jobs in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Submit Hadoop jobs in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure PowerShell to submit MapReduce and Hive jobs, and how to use the HDInsight .NET SDK to submit MapReduce, Hadoop streaming, and Hive jobs.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure PowerShell to submit MapReduce and Hive jobs, and how to use the HDInsight .NET SDK to submit MapReduce, Hadoop streaming, and Hive jobs.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this article must be performed from a Windows client.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this article must be performed from a Windows client.

trans-unit.source: For information on using a Linux, OS X, or Unix client to work with MapReduce, Hive, or Pig on HDInsight, see the following articles and select either the **SSH** or **Curl** links within each:
trans-unit.target: For information on using a Linux, OS X, or Unix client to work with MapReduce, Hive, or Pig on HDInsight, see the following articles and select either the **SSH** or **Curl** links within each:

trans-unit.source: Use Hive with HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Use Hive with HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Use Pig with HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Use Pig with HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Use MapReduce with HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Use MapReduce with HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **An Azure HDInsight cluster**.
trans-unit.target: **An Azure HDInsight cluster**.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Get started with HDInsight][hdinsight-get-started] or [Provision HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-provision].
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Get started with HDInsight][hdinsight-get-started] or [Provision HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-provision].

trans-unit.source: **A workstation with Azure PowerShell**.
trans-unit.target: **A workstation with Azure PowerShell**.

trans-unit.source: See [Install and use Azure PowerShell](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/install-and-use-azure-powershell/).
trans-unit.target: See [Install and use Azure PowerShell](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/install-and-use-azure-powershell/).

trans-unit.source: Submit MapReduce jobs by using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Submit MapReduce jobs by using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell is a powerful scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell is a powerful scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using Azure PowerShell with HDInsight, see [Manage HDInsight by using PowerShell][hdinsight-admin-powershell].
trans-unit.target: For more information about using Azure PowerShell with HDInsight, see [Manage HDInsight by using PowerShell][hdinsight-admin-powershell].

trans-unit.source: Hadoop MapReduce is a software framework for writing applications that process vast amounts of data.
trans-unit.target: Hadoop MapReduce is a software framework for writing applications that process vast amounts of data.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight clusters come with a JAR file (located at *\example\jars\hadoop-mapreduce-examples.jar*), which contains several MapReduce examples.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight clusters come with a JAR file (located at *\example\jars\hadoop-mapreduce-examples.jar*), which contains several MapReduce examples.

trans-unit.source: One of the examples is for counting word frequencies in source files.
trans-unit.target: One of the examples is for counting word frequencies in source files.

trans-unit.source: In this session, you will learn how to use Azure PowerShell from a workstation to run the word count sample.
trans-unit.target: In this session, you will learn how to use Azure PowerShell from a workstation to run the word count sample.

trans-unit.source: For more information about developing and running MapReduce jobs, see [Use MapReduce with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-mapreduce].
trans-unit.target: For more information about developing and running MapReduce jobs, see [Use MapReduce with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-mapreduce].

trans-unit.source: To run the word count MapReduce program by using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: To run the word count MapReduce program by using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Open **Azure PowerShell**.
trans-unit.target: Open **Azure PowerShell**.

trans-unit.source: For instructions about how to open the Azure PowerShell console window, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install-configure].
trans-unit.target: For instructions about how to open the Azure PowerShell console window, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install-configure].

trans-unit.source: Set the following variables by running these Azure PowerShell commands:
trans-unit.target: Set the following variables by running these Azure PowerShell commands:

trans-unit.source: The subscription name is the one you used to create the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The subscription name is the one you used to create the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight cluster is the one you want to use to run the MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight cluster is the one you want to use to run the MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to create a MapReduce job definition:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to create a MapReduce job definition:

trans-unit.source: There are two arguments.
trans-unit.target: There are two arguments.

trans-unit.source: The first one is the source file name, and the second is the output file path.
trans-unit.target: The first one is the source file name, and the second is the output file path.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the wasb:// prefix, see [Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight][hdinsight-storage].
trans-unit.target: For more information about the wasb:// prefix, see [Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight][hdinsight-storage].

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to run the MapReduce job:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to run the MapReduce job:

trans-unit.source: In addition to the MapReduce job definition, you also provide the HDInsight cluster name for where you want to run the MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the MapReduce job definition, you also provide the HDInsight cluster name for where you want to run the MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to check the completion of the MapReduce job:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to check the completion of the MapReduce job:

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to check any errors with running the MapReduce job:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to check any errors with running the MapReduce job:

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows the output of a successful run.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows the output of a successful run.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, you will see some error messages.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, you will see some error messages.

trans-unit.source: HDI.GettingStarted.RunMRJob
trans-unit.target: HDI.GettingStarted.RunMRJob

trans-unit.source: To retrieve the results of the MapReduce job
trans-unit.target: To retrieve the results of the MapReduce job

trans-unit.source: Open **Azure PowerShell**.
trans-unit.target: Open **Azure PowerShell**.

trans-unit.source: Set the following variables by running these Azure PowerShell commands:
trans-unit.target: Set the following variables by running these Azure PowerShell commands:

trans-unit.source: The Storage account name is the Azure storage account that you specified during the HDInsight cluster provision.
trans-unit.target: The Storage account name is the Azure storage account that you specified during the HDInsight cluster provision.

trans-unit.source: The storage account is used to host the blob container that is used as the default HDInsight cluster file system.
trans-unit.target: The storage account is used to host the blob container that is used as the default HDInsight cluster file system.

trans-unit.source: The container name usually share the same name as the HDInsight cluster unless you specify a different name when you provision the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The container name usually share the same name as the HDInsight cluster unless you specify a different name when you provision the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to create an Azure Blob storage context object:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to create an Azure Blob storage context object:

trans-unit.source: **Select-AzureSubscription** is used to set the current subscription if you have multiple subscriptions, and the default subscription is not the one to use.
trans-unit.target: **Select-AzureSubscription** is used to set the current subscription if you have multiple subscriptions, and the default subscription is not the one to use.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to download the MapReduce job output from the blob container to the workstation:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to download the MapReduce job output from the blob container to the workstation:

trans-unit.source: The *example/data/WordCountOutput* folder is the output folder specified when you run the MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: The *example/data/WordCountOutput* folder is the output folder specified when you run the MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: *part-r-00000* is the default file name for MapReduce job output.
trans-unit.target: *part-r-00000* is the default file name for MapReduce job output.

trans-unit.source: The file will be download to the same folder structure in the local folder.
trans-unit.target: The file will be download to the same folder structure in the local folder.

trans-unit.source: For example, in the following screenshot, the current folder is the C: root folder.
trans-unit.target: For example, in the following screenshot, the current folder is the C: root folder.

trans-unit.source: The file will be downloaded to:
trans-unit.target: The file will be downloaded to:

trans-unit.source: *C:\example\data\WordCountOutput\*
trans-unit.target: *C:\example\data\WordCountOutput\*

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to print the MapReduce job output file:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to print the MapReduce job output file:

trans-unit.source: HDI.GettingStarted.MRJobOutput
trans-unit.target: HDI.GettingStarted.MRJobOutput

trans-unit.source: The MapReduce job produces a file named *part-r-00000*, and it contains the words and the counts.
trans-unit.target: The MapReduce job produces a file named *part-r-00000*, and it contains the words and the counts.

trans-unit.source: The script uses the **findstr** command to list all of the words that contains "there."
trans-unit.target: The script uses the **findstr** command to list all of the words that contains "there."

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you open ./example/data/WordCountOutput/part-r-00000 (a multiline output from a MapReduce job) in Notepad, you will notice the line breaks do not render correctly.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you open ./example/data/WordCountOutput/part-r-00000 (a multiline output from a MapReduce job) in Notepad, you will notice the line breaks do not render correctly.

trans-unit.source: This is expected.
trans-unit.target: This is expected.

trans-unit.source: Submit Hive jobs by using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Submit Hive jobs by using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: [Apache Hive][apache-hive] provides a means of running MapReduce job through an SQL-like scripting language, called *HiveQL*, which can be applied to summarize, query, and analyze large volumes of data.
trans-unit.target: [Apache Hive][apache-hive] provides a means of running MapReduce job through an SQL-like scripting language, called *HiveQL*, which can be applied to summarize, query, and analyze large volumes of data.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight clusters come with a sample Hive table called *hivesampletable*.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight clusters come with a sample Hive table called *hivesampletable*.

trans-unit.source: In this session, you will use Azure PowerShell to run a Hive job to list some data from the Hive table.
trans-unit.target: In this session, you will use Azure PowerShell to run a Hive job to list some data from the Hive table.

trans-unit.source: To run a Hive job by using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: To run a Hive job by using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Open **Azure PowerShell**.
trans-unit.target: Open **Azure PowerShell**.

trans-unit.source: For instructions about how to open the Azure PowerShell console window, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install-configure].
trans-unit.target: For instructions about how to open the Azure PowerShell console window, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install-configure].

trans-unit.source: Set the first two variables in the following commands, and then run the commands:
trans-unit.target: Set the first two variables in the following commands, and then run the commands:

trans-unit.source: The $querystring is the HiveQL query.
trans-unit.target: The $querystring is the HiveQL query.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to select the Azure subscription and the cluster to run the Hive job:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to select the Azure subscription and the cluster to run the Hive job:

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to submit the hive job:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to submit the hive job:

trans-unit.source: You can use the **-File** switch to specify a HiveQL script file in the Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS).
trans-unit.target: You can use the **-File** switch to specify a HiveQL script file in the Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS).

trans-unit.source: For more information about Hive, see [Use Hive with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-hive].
trans-unit.target: For more information about Hive, see [Use Hive with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-hive].

trans-unit.source: Submit Hive jobs by using Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Submit Hive jobs by using Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: See [Get started using HDInsight Hadoop Tools for Visual Studio][hdinsight-visual-studio-tools].
trans-unit.target: See [Get started using HDInsight Hadoop Tools for Visual Studio][hdinsight-visual-studio-tools].

trans-unit.source: Submit Sqoop jobs by using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Submit Sqoop jobs by using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: See [Use Sqoop with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-sqoop].
trans-unit.target: See [Use Sqoop with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-sqoop].

trans-unit.source: Submit MapReduce jobs using HDInsight .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Submit MapReduce jobs using HDInsight .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides .NET client libraries, which makes it easier to work with HDInsight clusters from .NET.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides .NET client libraries, which makes it easier to work with HDInsight clusters from .NET.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight clusters come with a JAR file (located at *\example\jars\hadoop-mapreduce-examples.jar*), which contains several MapReduce examples.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight clusters come with a JAR file (located at *\example\jars\hadoop-mapreduce-examples.jar*), which contains several MapReduce examples.

trans-unit.source: One of the examples is for counting word frequencies in source files.
trans-unit.target: One of the examples is for counting word frequencies in source files.

trans-unit.source: In this session, you will learn how to create a .NET application to run the word count sample.
trans-unit.target: In this session, you will learn how to create a .NET application to run the word count sample.

trans-unit.source: For more information about developing and running MapReduce jobs, see [Use MapReduce with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-mapreduce].
trans-unit.target: For more information about developing and running MapReduce jobs, see [Use MapReduce with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-mapreduce].

trans-unit.source: The following procedures are needed to provision an HDInsight cluster by using the SDK:
trans-unit.target: The following procedures are needed to provision an HDInsight cluster by using the SDK:

trans-unit.source: Install the HDInsight .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Install the HDInsight .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: Create a console application
trans-unit.target: Create a console application

trans-unit.source: Run the application
trans-unit.target: Run the application

trans-unit.source: **To install the HDInsight .NET SDK**
trans-unit.target: **To install the HDInsight .NET SDK**

trans-unit.source: You can install latest published build of the SDK from [NuGet](http://nuget.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=Getting%20Started).
trans-unit.target: You can install latest published build of the SDK from [NuGet](http://nuget.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=Getting%20Started).

trans-unit.source: The instructions will be shown in the next procedure.
trans-unit.target: The instructions will be shown in the next procedure.

trans-unit.source: To create a Visual Studio console application
trans-unit.target: To create a Visual Studio console application

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: From the **File** menu, click **New**, and then click **Project**.
trans-unit.target: From the **File** menu, click **New**, and then click **Project**.

trans-unit.source: From **New Project**, type or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: From **New Project**, type or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Category
trans-unit.target: Category

trans-unit.source: Templates/Visual C#/Windows
trans-unit.target: Templates/Visual C#/Windows

trans-unit.source: Template
trans-unit.target: Template

trans-unit.source: Console Application
trans-unit.target: Console Application

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: SubmitMapReduceJob
trans-unit.target: SubmitMapReduceJob

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to create the project.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to create the project.

trans-unit.source: From the **Tools** menu, click **Library Package Manager**, and then click **Package Manager Console**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Tools** menu, click **Library Package Manager**, and then click **Package Manager Console**.

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands in the console to install the packages.
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands in the console to install the packages.

trans-unit.source: This command adds .NET libraries and references to them to the current Visual Studio project.
trans-unit.target: This command adds .NET libraries and references to them to the current Visual Studio project.

trans-unit.source: The version should be 0.11.0.1 or later.
trans-unit.target: The version should be 0.11.0.1 or later.

trans-unit.source: From **Solution Explorer**, double-click **Program.cs** to open it.
trans-unit.target: From **Solution Explorer**, double-click **Program.cs** to open it.

trans-unit.source: Add the following using statements to the top of the file:
trans-unit.target: Add the following using statements to the top of the file:

trans-unit.source: Add the following function definition to the class.
trans-unit.target: Add the following function definition to the class.

trans-unit.source: This function is used to wait for a Hadoop job to complete.
trans-unit.target: This function is used to wait for a Hadoop job to complete.

trans-unit.source: In the **Main()** function, paste the following code:
trans-unit.target: In the **Main()** function, paste the following code:

trans-unit.source: These are all of the variables you need to set for the program.
trans-unit.target: These are all of the variables you need to set for the program.

trans-unit.source: You can get the Azure subscription name from the [Azure preview portal][azure-management-portal].
trans-unit.target: You can get the Azure subscription name from the [Azure preview portal][azure-management-portal].

trans-unit.source: For information about the certificate, see [Create and Upload a Management Certificate for Azure][azure-certificate].
trans-unit.target: For information about the certificate, see [Create and Upload a Management Certificate for Azure][azure-certificate].

trans-unit.source: An easy way to configure the certificate is to run the **Get-AzurePublishSettingsFile** and **Import-AzurePublishSettingsFile** Azure PowerShell cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: An easy way to configure the certificate is to run the **Get-AzurePublishSettingsFile** and **Import-AzurePublishSettingsFile** Azure PowerShell cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: They will create and upload the management certificate automatically.
trans-unit.target: They will create and upload the management certificate automatically.

trans-unit.source: After you run these cmdlets, you can open **certmgr.msc** from the workstation, and find the certificate by expanding **Personal** > **Certificates**.
trans-unit.target: After you run these cmdlets, you can open **certmgr.msc** from the workstation, and find the certificate by expanding **Personal** > **Certificates**.

trans-unit.source: The certificate that is created by the Azure PowerShell cmdlets has Azure Tools for the **Issued To** and the **Issued By** fields.
trans-unit.target: The certificate that is created by the Azure PowerShell cmdlets has Azure Tools for the **Issued To** and the **Issued By** fields.

trans-unit.source: The Azure storage account name is the account you specify when you provision the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The Azure storage account name is the account you specify when you provision the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The default container name is the same as the HDInsight cluster name.
trans-unit.target: The default container name is the same as the HDInsight cluster name.

trans-unit.target: In the **Main()** function, append the following code to define the MapReduce job:

trans-unit.target: In the **Main()** function, append the following code to run the job and wait for the job to complete:

trans-unit.target: In the **Main()** function, append the following code to print the MapReduce job output:

trans-unit.source: The output folder is specified when you define the MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: The output folder is specified when you define the MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: The default file name is **part-r-00000**.
trans-unit.target: The default file name is **part-r-00000**.

trans-unit.source: To run the application
trans-unit.target: To run the application

trans-unit.source: While the application is open in Visual Studio, press **F5** to run the application.
trans-unit.target: While the application is open in Visual Studio, press **F5** to run the application.

trans-unit.source: A console window should open and display the status of the application and the application output.
trans-unit.target: A console window should open and display the status of the application and the application output.

trans-unit.source: Submit Hadoop streaming jobs using HDInsight .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Submit Hadoop streaming jobs using HDInsight .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: HDInsight clusters come with a word-counting Hadoop stream program, which is developed in C#.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight clusters come with a word-counting Hadoop stream program, which is developed in C#.

trans-unit.source: The mapper program is */example/apps/cat.exe*, and the reduce program is */example/apps/wc.exe*.
trans-unit.target: The mapper program is */example/apps/cat.exe*, and the reduce program is */example/apps/wc.exe*.

trans-unit.source: In this session, you will learn how to create a .NET application to run the word-counting sample.
trans-unit.target: In this session, you will learn how to create a .NET application to run the word-counting sample.

trans-unit.source: For the details about creating a .NET application for submitting MapReduce jobs, see [Submit MapReduce jobs using HDInsight .NET SDK](#mapreduce-sdk).
trans-unit.target: For the details about creating a .NET application for submitting MapReduce jobs, see [Submit MapReduce jobs using HDInsight .NET SDK](#mapreduce-sdk).

trans-unit.source: For more information about developing and deploying Hadoop streaming jobs, see [Develop C# Hadoop streaming programs for HDInsight][hdinsight-develop-streaming-jobs].
trans-unit.target: For more information about developing and deploying Hadoop streaming jobs, see [Develop C# Hadoop streaming programs for HDInsight][hdinsight-develop-streaming-jobs].

trans-unit.source: Submit Hive jobs by using HDInsight .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Submit Hive jobs by using HDInsight .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: HDInsight clusters come with a sample Hive table called *hivesampletable*.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight clusters come with a sample Hive table called *hivesampletable*.

trans-unit.source: In this session, you will create a .NET application to run a Hive job to list the Hive tables that are created in an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this session, you will create a .NET application to run a Hive job to list the Hive tables that are created in an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using Hive, see [Use Hive with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-hive].
trans-unit.target: For more information about using Hive, see [Use Hive with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-hive].

trans-unit.source: This function is used to wait for a Hadoop job to complete.

trans-unit.source: You can get the Azure Subscription ID from your system administrator.
trans-unit.target: You can get the Azure Subscription ID from your system administrator.

trans-unit.source: For information about the certificate, see [Create and Upload a Management Certificate for Azure][azure-certificate].
trans-unit.target: For information about the certificate, see [Create and Upload a Management Certificate for Azure][azure-certificate].

trans-unit.source: An easy way to configure the certificate is to run the **Get-AzurePublishSettingsFile** and **Import-AzurePublishSettingsFile** Azure PowerShell cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: An easy way to configure the certificate is to run the **Get-AzurePublishSettingsFile** and **Import-AzurePublishSettingsFile** Azure PowerShell cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: They will create and upload the management certificate automatically.
trans-unit.target: They will create and upload the management certificate automatically.

trans-unit.source: After you run these cmdlets, you can open **certmgr.msc** from the workstation, and find the certificate by expanding **Personal** > **Certificates**.
trans-unit.target: After you run these cmdlets, you can open **certmgr.msc** from the workstation, and find the certificate by expanding **Personal** > **Certificates**.

trans-unit.source: The certificate created by the Azure PowerShell cmdlets has Azure Tools for the **Issued To** and the **Issued By** fields.
trans-unit.target: The certificate created by the Azure PowerShell cmdlets has Azure Tools for the **Issued To** and the **Issued By** fields.
